basics.name: Yao-Ting, Huang
basics.summary: As an Electrical Engineering undergraduate at National Taiwan University, I have amassed substantial research experience through my work at NTU-RobotLearning-Lab and the Advanced Control Laboratory. My innovative edge is showcased by a portfolio of side projects, including a prize-winning VR Quidditch simulator and the “Magic Hand” gesture-controlled presentation system. My practical problem-solving capabilities have been further honed through internships at CAVEDU, where I focused on AI education, and at Industrial Technology Research Institute(ITRI), working on autonomous vehicle systems.

location.address: Rm. 3, 4F., No. 247, Chongcing Rd., Banciao Dist.

work.name: Industrial Technology Research Institute(ITRI)
work.summary: Contributed to the self-driving automobile group by applying reinforcement learning for behavioral prediction of autonomous vehicles. And designed a virtual training environment for reinforcement learning framework based on real-world collected vehicle data.

courses: Computer Vision: from recognition to geometry*

awards.title: Best Applications & 3rd prize of enterprise prize
